title: Semantik Architect  Frame: Relational causal / influence

frame_type.description: Canonical frame identifier for the causal / influence family. For this frame, the canonical value is "rel.causal-influence"; the family-level type is "relation.causal".

cause.description: The causal side of the relation: typically an Event (e.g. a policy change, a crisis, an intervention) or an Entity that stands in for an event (e.g. a law, an institution). Shape follows semantics.types.Event or semantics.types.Entity.

effect.description: The effect side of the relation: typically an Event or state change, but occasionally an Entity if that entity’s state is what changes. Shape follows semantics.types.Event or semantics.types.Entity.

causal_relation.description: Coarse label describing the subtype of causal / influence relation. Recommended values include: "cause", "contributes-to", "leads-to", "triggers", "enables", "prevents", "associated-with". Projects may extend this inventory.

polarity.description: Optional high-level polarity of the effect from the perspective of the subject or narrator. Typical values: "positive", "negative", "mixed", "neutral".

strength.description: Optional numerical strength of the relationship, in whatever scale a project chooses (e.g. 0.0–1.0, or 1–5). Engines should not assume any particular scaling convention.

time.description: Optional TimeSpan indicating when the causal influence is understood to hold, or when the effect occurred. Shape follows semantics.types.TimeSpan.

scope_description.description: Optional free-text description of the scope or context of the relationship (e.g. "in Europe", "among low-income countries", "in the 1990s").

mechanism_lemmas.description: Lemma-level hints about the mechanism or pathway of influence, e.g. ["economic", "political"] or ["through trade", "through migration"]. These are language-neutral and may be mapped to surface phrases by NLG components.

mechanism_gloss.description: Optional short textual gloss explaining the mechanism in more detail. This is language-specific and should only be surfaced when appropriate.

evidence.description: Optional structured evidence / provenance information for the causal claim. Typical keys might include 'source', 'source_type', 'confidence', 'citation_keys'. NLG components should treat this as opaque metadata.

attributes.description: Free-form attribute bag for additional structured information about this causal relation, beyond the core fields. Examples: {"reversibility": "irreversible", "lag_years": 10}.

extra.description: Reserved for pipeline- or source-specific metadata that should not affect generation but may be useful for debugging or analysis.

relation_type.description: Legacy field: coarse label for the causal relation. Prefer 'causal_relation' for new data.

cause_entity.description: Legacy field: cause-side entity. Prefer 'cause', which may also be an Event.

effect_entity.description: Legacy field: effect-side entity. Prefer 'effect', which may also be an Event.

time_span.description: Legacy field: generic time span for the relation. Prefer 'time'.
